intro: Nothoscordum altillanense, commonly known as the Mexican garlic plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and mild garlic-like aroma. Nothoscordum altillanense is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and full sun.
